noun.description: A temporary state of mind or feeling.
examples: he appeared to be in a very good mood about something

adjective.description: (especially of music) inducing or suggestive of a particular feeling or state of mind.
synonyms: in the right frame of mind for
in the right frame of mind to

phrases: if you're in the mood for an extra thrill, you can go paragliding
I'm feeling quite positive today and in the mood to make resolutions.
Perhaps to try and get people in the mood to start shopping early so they can benefit?
I love reading poems and even try to pen down a couple of them whenever I am in the mood to do so.
Something he wrote triggered a load of memories of my mum, and I just feel in the mood to write about her today.
origin: Mid 16th century: variant of mode, influenced by mood.
